comment: Lectures were super boring and not helpful. He goes on rants about useless things and not the test material. Only grades are quizzes and tests. Tests are 50+ questions, difficult, not lockdown, some with written responses. Has bonus final and quiz to replace lowest grades. So much material and reading. Attendance mandatory. Nice guy though.

- Attendance is mandatory, but gives 5 free skips! I understood lectures better by showing up.
- Quizzes + Exams open notes! EZ grades
- Open 4 questions + participation! Chill professor + hilarious/interesting stories!
- Textbook is free + linked in chapters
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: I enjoyed having Professor Buttrick. I will say as someone with a low attention span and the class being at 3:30pm, I found myself fighting sleep in this class a lot, since all he does is lecture. As long as you show up and do the weekly quizzes/tests, its an easy A. He did have some very interesting stories and would let us out early every class!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: Hated this class. No discussion posts with fairly easy quizzes and tests, but the lectures had very little to do with the tests, and you would just waste your time sitting there. Pulled questions from old tests that ended up being wrong and never fixed some of them. Frustrating to work with, but manageable.

Professor Buttrick was a good professor. If you just follow his weekly overview to know what to for the week you'll be fine. He can be a little harsh on grading discussion posts so just make sure you closely follow the rubric. His exams are open book and open notes!

This class was pretty easy as long as you complete the checklist he gives weekly. He is a bit picky on how you write your discussion posts so I recommend using outside sources provided to you for an A. The syllabus also wasn't followed to a T but it was due to things he couldn't control but he will let you know. Extends due dates as well if needed.
best professor ever. easiest class. attendance is graded but you get 5 free skips. He is around to answer questions. He is also super caring and personable.

All you have to do in this course is turn your weekly assignments in on time to do well. The work usually consists of a discussion post and or a quiz. there are three mandatory exams and an extra credit final. No lock down browser or web cam :) I really liked his class, definitely an easy A if you put in some effort!
This class was so easy. All the quizzes and tests were online without lockdown...

Steven is pretty straightforward. He pushes dates back on assignments to let students keep up. I suggest buying the textbook online through Vitalsource and highlighting the answers in the textbook for the upcoming ones when doing the exams.

This is by far the worst professor ive had at ksu. He is unorganized and assigned so many assignments but took so long to grade them. He critiques on every little thing and is extremely scatter brained

He is by far one of my favorite professors. He helps you understand the material. Definitely read the study guides and read the text as well. Attendance is mandatory but it helps your grade. He is very helpful with emailing and helps you if you missed something. I enjoyed his class and learned.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: He is a very funny professor, and his exams and quizzes were very easy. I barely paid attention in class only went because attendance was mandatory but he does a final exam as optional. His final exam replaces your lowest exam grade it's only to benefit you. I would take him!! EASY A
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Buttrick's lectures were entertaining, however they did not help me for the quizzes and tests. He went off topic a lot, and his lectures did not really reflect the assignments, however if you study his guides, you should be fine. 20% of your grade is attendance, so just show up!

Really funny and nice guy, tests and quizzes are all online no lockdown and quizlet will help you a good bit, lectures are good BUT lectures often do not reflect the tests completely, so you have to read the notes he posts, but he does post them, no papers, really tries to give opportunities and extra credit so everyone passes, good guy, not hard

Whoever says this professor is bad is lying. He's funny and helpful. The quizzes and exams are all online no lockdown and they're all relatively easy. If you put effort in, you will get an A. Only thing about him is the attendance which you still get 4 unexcused absences. Attendance is 20% of the grade.
Makes funny jokes and tells lots of stories. Some of what he lectured wasn't on the quizzes but provided notes. Gives you 4 unexcused absents.

He would assign things that were not on the syllabus to begin with. During the last weeks of school, he decided to assign a random test (that was not in the syllabus) during the week of Thanksgiving. The only real good thing about him is that when he has to grade stuff (like things that aren't automatically graded) he is pretty fair.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Take him bruh trust. Attendance is 20% of your grade so all you gotta do is show up and take notes.

He's so funny and entertaining, all his tests and exams are online w/ out lockdown browser, unlimited time. Super chill and lets you miss up to 4 classes. He's very understanding. Easy A. 

He gives off uncle vibes in the best way possible. TAKE HIM!

This is the worst professor I've ever dealt with. I've never known someone to be so scatterbrained and then have the temerity to penalize people who get low scores on his quizzes and tests. Impossible to reach and complains about people trying to contact him - I would've gotten better lectures from a stick insect.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: He's a good professor overall. Attendance is taken and you're allowed to miss at least 4 days because at the end of semester he will replace missed days with wildcard days and you'll still get a 100% for attendance. Lectures can be hard to listen to because he sometimes goes off topic. And for quizzes and exams you can use notes and the textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I think pretty great for a political science class. His lectures were generally interesting and sometimes maybe off topic, but the tests & quizzes are nothing crazy. Each one is unlimited time making them feel not that stressful. You might need to teach yourself a bit of the material but after the first test you do get the hang of it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Don't take this professor. He is so scatterbrained and it's IMPOSSIBLE to sit through his lectures. He's a cool guy, but he never stays on topic and rarely talks about content you need to know. He doesn't use guided notes or powerpoints so its so hard to take notes during class. Theres a quiz every week and about 4 exams with an optional final.

His teaching style is talking and showing a word document with paragraphs of info. If you're a visual learner, this is NOT the class. He's hard to follow and the quizzes are difficult, even with the notes he posts. Assignments are all online, but attendance is mandatory (attend all but 4 days and it's a 100% test grade). Final is optional.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Nice guy, passionate & knowledgable. Quizzes & exams are online & open note. Attendance is a grade/EC points for showing up. BUT- it's excruciating to sit in his lectures as they are so boring. It's nearly impossible to take any notes because he is all over the place (spunky personality), thankfully he posts his lecture notes online. Textbook helps

Very test heavy but provides study guides. By actively listening in his class your thought process will change. He will teach you to evaluate choices and decisions laid before you that pertain to government differently. Overall a great professor that I will occasionally drop by to listen to his lectures when free.
